intro: Leptilon canadense, commonly known as Canada leptail, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and wetlands. It has slender, erect stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, greenish-white flowers appear in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer.
